result.markdown: --- title: "About me" about: template: solana image: profile.jpg image-width: 12em image-shape: round links: - icon: envelope text: Email href: mailto:wyaravms@gmail.com - icon: file text: Lattes href: http://lattes.cnpq.br/5538303153427476 - icon: google scholar text: Google Scholar href: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=2kt3OlEAAAAJ&hl=en - icon: twitter text: Twitter href: https://twitter.com/wyaravms - icon: github text: Github href: https://github.com/wyaravms - icon: film text: Letterboxd href: https://letterboxd.com/wvmouras/ comments: false --- ::: {#hero-heading} Hi, my name is Wyara Silva, I'm a statistician, currently doing my PhD in Statistics at UFMG. I'm addicted to coffee, passionate about cinema and also I'm orange belt in karate. Osu. ## Education Doctoral Student in Statistics (2023-Current) \ Federal University of Minas Gerais (UFMG) Master degree in Applied Mathematics and Statistics (2015-2017)\ Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte (UFRN) Bachelor degree in Statistics (2010-2015)\ Federal University of Piauí (UFPI) ## Publications Moura E Silva, W. V.; Ramírez Orozco, D. L. (2022). [Evaluación de rendimiento de los estimadores para los parámetros de la Distribución Burr XII. Comunicaciones En Estadística](https://dialnet.unirioja.es/servlet/articulo?codigo=8710099), v. 15, p. 1-14. Silva, Wyara Vanesa Moura E; Nascimento, Fernando Ferraz Do; Bourguingnon, Marcelo (2020). [A change-point model for the r-largest order statistics with applications to environmental and financial data](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.apm.2020.01.064), Applied Mathematical Modelling, Volume 82, Pages 666-679, ISSN 0307-904X. E Silva, Wyara Vanesa Moura; Do Nascimento, Fernando Ferraz (2019) [MCMC4Extremes: an R package for Bayesian inference for extremes and its extensions](https://doi.org/10.1080/03610918.2019.1653914), Communications in Statistics - Simulation and Computation, 51:2, 432-442. Ferraz Do Nascimento, Fernando; Moura E Silva, Wyara Vanesa (2017) [A Bayesian model for multiple change point to extremes, with application to environmental and financial data](https://doi.org/10.1080/02664763.2016.1254733), Journal of Applied Statistics, 44:13, 2410-2426. ## Experience # Heading 1 Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
